result.execSummary:
The defendant Elan G Whiteeagle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: District Attorney Daniel S. Diehn appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Roush.  Defendant plead guilty  to Count 1 in 15CT63 and 16CM151 .   Count 2 in 15CT63 dismissed but read in for sentencing purposes.   Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charges the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood. Defendant stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of OAR contrary to 343.44(1)(b) and resist/obstruction contrary to 946.41(1).  Joint recommendation for:  45 days jail.  Concurrent.  Time served.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.   Court ordered the same.  CC.  Apply bond on file.  Balance payable @ $50.00 per month starting 11/1.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.    The defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Roush appeared in court.  Defense requesting a bond modification.  Requesting the original $300.00 bond be reinstated, or $200.00 - $300.00 additional.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 30, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
STC canceled and scheduled for PLEAS per request of SPD Amanda Roush; also BBH to request bond modification.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Amanda Roush

Pre-trial conference on August 28, 2019 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 9, 2019 at 03:00 pm.
The defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.

THIS IS IN ADDITION TO ANY CASH PREVIOUSLY POSTED.  Covers both 15CT63 & 16CM151: Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.    The defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Roush appeared in court.  Defense requesting a signature bond, or reinstate cash bond. State requesting $1,000.00 cash bond.  PTC set for 8/28 and STC set for 9/9 at 3 pm.

15CT63 & 16CM151:  Defendant appears by video from Jackson County Jail with Attorney Artis and Attorney SPD Amanda Roush both present in the courtroom. ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Artis agrees SPD Roush should take over both cases.  He does qualify for SPD representation.  Court questions defendant and he states he wishes to have SPD representation on both cases and Attorney Artis to be withdrawn.  Court approves and Attorney Artis will file a written Order on 15CT63.  

15CT63 - received a previous offer.  16CM151 - initial today, defense waives reading of complaint, stands mute.  Court enters NGP.  His address is correct as is.  State requests the $500 cash bond cover both cases with previous conditions.  Defense requests a sig bond.  Court orders another $300 cash bond to cover both cases with same conditions as previously ordered.  Set PTC for 9-27 at 10 a.m. with STC on both cases 10-9-17 at 3 p.m.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.    The defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Artis appeared in court, specially on 16CM151.  Defendant has tried SPD but no one is answering.  Attorney Artis will talk to the defendant.  Adjourn to 1:00 today, or back up AIA set for 9/25 at 9 am.
